doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
creation: 18th century; alteration: circa 1809; alteration: circa 1850; alteration: 1870s; alteration: circa 1989

Franklin Minor Classical School--James Dinsmore Country Home (where he drowned in 1830) --Peter (d. 1835) then Hugh (d. 1858) then Franklin (d. 1867) Minor Home--Mrs Lucy Ann Gilmer Minor, widow of Franklin Minor, Home until 1881 --Lydia M Lyman Home 1895--C E Blue Home 1903--China Closet Glass engraved with Peter Minor and window pane with R L Maury 1857 Floor plan similar to Brookhill by 1st cousin James Minor

2 Story Brick with Center Gable, 5 Bay, 2 Pile, Flemish Bond, Queen Closers, 3 Course American Bond, Built-in Cabinets, 3 Story Stair, Reciprocating Saw Marks, Split Rivens, Center Passage not Through House, Earth Insulation in Floors and Walls, Attic Water Tank, Porch, Bellcast Roof, Brackets, 6 Panel Doors, 4 Panel Doors, Bay Window, Pointed Windows, 6/6, 9/9, Icehouse, 1905 Barn, Gardens, Parterres, Cemetery
survey data: Virginia Road Traces--Work Projects Administration
Home of Capt Jos Smith--Razed--Peter Minor built brick house--Roof & Windows altered
